Visit our JD Admissions page         Graduate Programs   NYU Law's Graduate Division is among the largest and most intellectually diverse of its kind in the nation. Students come from around the world, participate in the intellectual and social life of our community, and benefit from our faculty’s commitment to teaching and research. JD Admissions | NYU School of Law                           Skip to main content                                     ›               Quicklinks       Areas of Study   Calendar   Career Services   Colloquia   Courses   Departments   Directories   Docket   Housing   Library   News and Press   NYU Home   Student Links   Technology                                              JD Admissions   Faculty & Scholarship   Global Opportunities   LLM/JSD Admissions   Academics & Courses   Law & Business   Executive Education   Current Students   Public Service   About NYU Law   Alumni & Giving   Centers & Institutes                               Home › JD Admissions             JD Admissions                                     Ahead of the Curve   NYU Law has long set the pace in legal education, and continues to do so today, introducing innovative changes to the curriculum aimed at assuring that our graduates are well prepared for law practice in the 21st century. Read More        Public Service   NYU Law’s goal is for all graduates to incorporate public service into their careers. To that end, we have built the most comprehensive public service infrastructure of any law school in the nation.   Read More       Global Opportunities   The new NYU Law Abroad Program gives 3Ls the chance to spend a semester immersed in the law and legal culture of Buenos Aires, Paris, or Shanghai through a program designed by the Law School. Read More        Law and Business   Herbert Kelleher ’56, the charismatic founder of Southwest Airlines, visited campus for the NYU Leadership Series in Law & Business, just one aspect of NYU Law's comprehensive law and business program. Read More                       Quick Links       Applicants   Class Profile   Why NYU Law   Areas of Study   Dual Degrees   Scholarship Programs   Tuition and Financial Aid   Career Services   Housing   Planning a Visit   Recruitment Calendar   Admitted Students   Contact Us                    ABA Required Disclosures                   Located in New York City's incomparable Greenwich Village, NYU Law is an intellectual powerhouse with an outstanding curriculum that features 103 of the world's best faculty , 329 courses , 39 clinics , 11 areas of study , more than 30 centers and more than 80 student organizations.   The Law School is committed to enrolling a student body from a broad spectrum of society, with the strongest combination of qualifications and the greatest potential to contribute to the diversity and dynamism of the Law School community. To hear students and recent alumni talk about their NYU Law experiences, visit our new multimedia project, "The View from Washington Square."     ​NYU Law has a range of signature scholarship programs that provide up to full tuition, as well as intensive mentoring to develop tomorrow’s leaders, including the Furman Academic Fellowship program for those who focus on future legal teaching careers, the Root-Tilden-Kern Scholarship Program in public interest, and the Jacobson Leadership Program in Law and Business .                      Innovative 1L year   The 1L curriculum includes the specially-designed Legislation and Regulatory State, an elective, and Lawyering .                   Plan a Visit to the Village   Get a sense of the wonders of our great New York location. Here's what you need to know to plan a visit.                    On-Campus Housing   Two-thirds of 1Ls live in affordable, on-campus NYU Law housing .                 Life at NYU Law         The following are items recently posted to our student-written blog, Life at NYU Law . The blog is organized by category (e.g., Classes, Tips and Advice, Jobs ) if you'd like to dig in further to any particular topic.       Tulips and Time Management   This spring has been quite lovely, especially for a First Spring. I’m declaring this particular spring my First Spring because, as any other Florida native will tell you, there’s no such...      My Spring Break: Cuban Law and Society   Terron Ferguson writes about his spring break trip to Cuba with fellow students in the Cuba Legal Studies Group and faculty adviser Sylvia Law ’68, Elizabeth K. Dollard Professor of Law,...      Take Note: Fulfill NYU’s Writing Requirement with your Journal’s NWP   The irony of trying to write this post about the Notes Writing Program at my journal, the Annual Survey of American Law, during spring semester of my 2L year is that I should be working on my Note!...        See more on the Life at NYU Law blog.
